instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b logic board with no water damage signs the guy that send it to me told me that has knock down capacitor <CAPACITOR>C7251</CAPACITOR> 150UF 20% 6.3V POLY-BIA-SM i replace it but when i turn on the computer i still get 3 beeps. I've checked the RAM put few different ones I've checked the RAM slots under the microscope they look good i checked all rails are present also double checked for <SIGNAL>PVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and i have that too. I was doing research online for the beeps i find out on apple website for trouble shooting that those beeps can indicate problems with RAM or the MCP. Kinda confused now. Any ideas ? Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: maybe the board was dropped, my guess is bad PCH.... No MCP on this boards...

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: I would say bad PCH or the board is cracked somewhere and this will be hell. If you move the board around see if it boots in different positions but I sincerely doubt this will go anywhere.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: its the ram power rail , i had the same problem, fixed it with changing the chip, i think <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> not sure. pls chk schematic...

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: Check voltage on L7330. If that is ok use a RAM slot tester to see if any data lines are open.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3 beeps in 5 seconds
threads.message: So I checked for <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL> on point 2 on L7330 it was missing and i saw that <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL> is coming from <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> also checked the pins 12 and 2 for voltage, and i had voltage on pin 12 but not on 2 so i couldn't find where that voltage is generated so i replaced the <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> and solved my problem. Thanks for your help guys :)
